basics.name: Zoe Zhou
basics.label: 3rd-year Computer Science student, GPA 8.8/10 (top 10%), graduate in 2026

work.name: Automata and Complexity & Probability and Statistics
highlights: Led weekly tutorials, assisted with exercises, and supported students during course sessions.

work.name: Social AI Lab, Computer Science Department, Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam
highlights: Deployed a VR controller-based teleoperation interface on a physical robotic arm; tested and iteratively refined on hardware.
Designed and conducted a humanâ€“robot interaction user study (N=25); collected and analyzed workload and usability metrics.
Collaborated with researchers and lab engineers; scoped and resolved technical problems; fully documented and open-sourced the system.

work.name: ImCare Biotech, Doylestown, PA, USA
highlights: Improved missing data handling via KNN imputation, increasing predictive sensitivity by 12%.
Applied SMOTE for data augmentation and developed a logistic regression model in PyTorch, achieving an AUC-ROC of 0.87.
Enabled an estimated 680 additional early-stage detections per 100,000 screenings.

awards.title: 1st Place in 4th Annual Hack4her (Track: Ethical AI Agents for Public Services)
summary: Won first place at a national women-in-tech hackathon for students. Designed an ethical AI system to automate childcare allowance approval processes.

publications.name: Static Is Not Enough: A Comparative Study of VR and SpaceMouse in Static and Dynamic Teleoperation Tasks
publications.summary: This work is based on a summer research internship conducted at the Social AI Lab. I am the first author. Accepted to the HRI 2026 Late-Breaking Reports track in January 2026.
